content: in coq, every inductive datatype foo generates an induction principle. so if i declare nat in the usual way, i can type Check nat_ind. to print the proof obligation (forall (P : nat -> Prop), P z -> (forall n, P n -> P $ s n) -> forall n, P n). what is the lean version of this? I just want to print induction principle to info

Does

#check Nat.rec

do what you want?
Quinn has marked this topic as resolved.
